intro: Leptopogon ibityensis, commonly known as the Madagascar grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. It has small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of tiny, spike-like flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
